page.title: 16MUSEUMS - NAPTON NICKELODEON
page.content: We went to Napton Nickelodeon in the High Street. It is owned by Mr. Whitehead. He shows films and has a collection of musical instruments. He has restored many of the instruments himself and he will play them for groups of people who visit the museum. Parts of the collection date from the late 19th and early 20th century and come from all over Europe. The collection includes a hurdy gurdy, barrel organs, a one man band, a photo player, early juke boxes and musical dolls. At the top of the museum is a perfectly fitted cinema complete with a pre-war cafe and a Compton Cinema organ from a cinema in Hammersmith. The organ rises from the basement, as it would in its original setting. He holds film shows and shows cartoons, comedy films and Pathe News, including the last edition of Pathe News.
